issue.title: Upon bundling, segway tries to reference an accumulator file for a run that was never queued in minibatch

content.raw: GMTK creates this error. Check the arguments for the bundle job. It is being given a range for accumulators that goes beyond 756.
content.html: GMTK creates this error. Check the arguments for the bundle job. It is being given a range for accumulators that goes beyond 756.

issue.title: Upon bundling, segway tries to reference an accumulator file for a run that was never queued in minibatch

content.raw: The arguments for loadAccRange are a comma separated list, and are not sorted for minibatch jobs. It looks like segway cuts off reading the list partway for some reason (despite the correct arguments being written to run.sh and details.sh). The issue is not argument length, as much longer arguments have been passed in other runs. It looks like this is causing a Range::Parse error I've been trying to solve and it's possible it's causing this error as well.
content.html: The arguments for loadAccRange are a comma separated list, and are not sorted for minibatch jobs. It looks like segway cuts off reading the list partway for some reason (despite the correct arguments being written to run.sh and details.sh). The issue is not argument length, as much longer arguments have been passed in other runs. It looks like this is causing a Range::Parse error I've been trying to solve and it's possible it's causing this error as well.

issue.title: Upon bundling, segway tries to reference an accumulator file for a run that was never queued in minibatch

content.raw: Just confirmed that they are the same issue, as I suspected. The parameter passed to SGE is cut off partway through the list of windows. The number of numbers is not constant, but the number of characters without spaces appears to be constant, at 1024. Cutting off in the middle of the window list,  say, "12,13,14", can cause either the Range::Parse error (ie, "12,13,") or this missing acc error (ie, "12,13,1" and 1 is not a valid window)
content.html: Just confirmed that they are the same issue, as I suspected. The parameter passed to SGE is cut off partway through the list of windows. The number of numbers is not constant, but the number of characters without spaces appears to be constant, at 1024. Cutting off in the middle of the window list, say, "12,13,14", can cause either the Range::Parse error (ie, "12,13,") or this missing acc error (ie, "12,13,1" and 1 is not a valid window)

issue.title: Upon bundling, segway tries to reference an accumulator file for a run that was never queued in minibatch

content.raw: This is caused by [issue 70](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/issues/72/segway-on-sge-does-not-submit-job) and resolved in [pull request #55](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/pull-requests/55).
content.html: This is caused by issue 70 and resolved in pull request #55.
